title: CK Guy's Keen 5 Level Pack
content:
I was looking around on the Keen Wiki, and in the mods section, I found an article about a Keen 5 mod I've never played before.

[url=http://www.shikadi.net/keenwiki/CK_Guy%27s_Keen_5_Level_Pack]www.shikadi.net/keenwiki/...Level_Pack[/url]

I looked around on the forum and I couldn't find anyplace to download it, or even anyplace where anybody mentions it. What is this level pack? Is it still in progress, or is it downloadable?

title: Re: CK Guy's Keen 5 Level Pack
content:
I've played it, but I'm not sure what/where the latest version is. And I'm also not sure whether CK Guy is continuing it or not.

[url=http://www.keenmodding.org/viewtopic.php?t=183&highlight=guy+levelpack]www.keenmodding.org/viewt...+levelpack[/url]-Genius314

title: Re: CK Guy's Keen 5 Level Pack
content:
How can I download it? The link in that thread does not work.A lesson in Ascillan:

In the Dawn of a new age
"Hu beikacho-yon xa beidhakyo-yut."

In an eternal quest for world peace.
"Hu ebe'et sayboo'lin-yut yyk choo'i-yon."

Will you be my friend?
"Chi choo'zilli xa ut kle?"

title: Re: CK Guy's Keen 5 Level Pack
Re: CK Guy's Keen 5 Level Pack
content:
It's pretty good level pack, although not yet completed I think. Not sure if he works on it anymore, probably at times but not actively. The levels are huge, complex, and full of secrets.3D Realms: "Do you think there'll ever be a sequel to your game(s)?"
Tom Hall: "If I owned Keen, there sure would be. I don't consider that GBA game canon by any means."

title: Re: CK Guy's Keen 5 Level Pack
content:
He's kinda busy working on his [url=http://www.keenmodding.org/viewforum.php?f=29]level editor for Keen: Vorticons[/url] (version 1.0 already released), and his [url=http://www.keenmodding.org/viewforum.php?f=28]Tileset flags (TileInfo) editor for Keen: Galaxy[/url] (Ck456Tli, version 2.0 released; if you remember old versions of this tool, all I can say is that it has greatly improved, and has an user interface even better than Andy's CK1-3 TileInfo tool).------------------------------
[url=http://shadowm2006.sitesled.com/]My website[/url]
[url=http://p072.ezboard.com/fpubliccommanderkeenforumfrm20.showMessage?topicID=12.topic]Get Windows/Linux native LModKeen 2 with integrated FIN2BMP![/url]. You know you want to.
[url=http://shadowm2006.sitesled.com/meta/projectpage.htm]The META engine for 2D games[/url].

title: update
content:
Woah, cool to hear people are still playing this. And yeah, I haven't really worked on this much lately at all. There's another level and a half done on my hard drive from what's in release four. If people want, I could focus on this - I had been planning on making an separate carmackizer (Shadow Master: Yes, it will be GOD, lol).

And also, incidentally, Ck456Tli is up to version 3.2, and Mindbelt is up to 1.2.2 ;-)

Anyway, yeah, again cool to hear people play this. Should I continue work on this instead of Keen utils?

title: Re: update
content:
Well, good tools are always needed so you shouldn't drop those projects, but personally I'd like to see a new release of this level pack even more. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img] So, if you can just work on the level pack for a while... [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-grin.gif[/img] 3D Realms: "Do you think there'll ever be a sequel to your game(s)?"
Tom Hall: "If I owned Keen, there sure would be. I don't consider that GBA game canon by any means."

title: Re: update
content:

title: Re: update
content:
Well I would love to see a finished episode. And we know you can make professional maps. So I vote for the levels.----

[img]http://img294.imageshack.us/img294/1923/untitled116qa.gif[/img]
Tough Bloogs eat princesses

title: Progress is a wonderful thing.
content:
Well, I just made the separate carmackizer today--it only took like two hours--and then I went on to working on the levels. Hopefully you guys'll see release five sometime in November.

I don't know why I didn't work on that separate carmackizer before--I guess I was expecting it to be harder than it turned out to be.

Keen modders/level editors--check out the K:M "TED5" forum for info on the separate carmack compressor.

title: Re: Progress is a wonderful thing.
content:
If this really speeds up level editing, that's great. I like the name too .[img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-lol.gif[/img] ----
